instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message:
Hi got a mega strange 820-2915. it was working fine and pop, C4696 blows out. I replace it and the same happens again, i replace the entire USB power circuit, same again. i just think- ill rmeove USB power completely and see what it does, after a little while some more smoke comes out, this time its blown a whole in u7300, a previusly working component, Its also destroyed the pp5vs3 trace on it.

Seems to be blowing up anything random on the pp5vs3 rail at this point.
Any ideas?

threads.title: 820-2915 blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: Over voltage from somewhere. Good chance the board is totally fried now.

threads.title: 820-2915 blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: If the board is still alive I'd replace U7201 and Q7260. I have no other ideas what can cause the voltage spikes.

threads.title: 820-2915 blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: yeah, i can get it to run again i reckon. Thanks for the suggestions.
